name: Irish Boxty
author: Brooke Elizabeth
summary: Boxty is a traditional Irish dish made of potatoes.  An old Irish rhyme goes: 'Boxty on the griddle, boxty on the pan; if you can't make boxty, you'll never get a man'.
directions: Toss the grated potatoes with flour in a large bowl
Stir in mashed potatoes until combined
In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg and skim milk; mix into the potatoes
Season to taste with salt and pepper
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Drop in the potato mixture, forming patties about 2 inches in diameter
Fry on both sides until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes per side
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate
